text: I've seen people conclude data was useless that I was able to use, and seen people claim data was extremely valuable and must be used at all costs that was well - garbage :stuck_out_tongue:.

elements.text: I've seen people conclude data was useless that I was able to use, and seen people claim data was extremely valuable and must be used at all costs that was well - garbage

text: Mutual information is good, but it doesn't handle second order information. IE: if two features need special preprocessing to become valuable it can't say anything about it. A good example might be something cyclic that can be flattened? maybe

elements.text: Mutual information is good, but it doesn't handle second order information. IE: if two features need special preprocessing to become valuable it can't say anything about it. A good example might be something cyclic that can be flattened? maybe

text: But yea here's the fun part about the question you've asked. If you could generically determine if a dataset could be used/manipulated to regress/classify/whatever another property. You may end up solving the artificial intelligence problem hehehe. I tried once, and ended up making some weird unsupervised decision tree. Got a paper out of it, but thats it lol
